abstract: Tennessee was handed a huge gift in the form of a pass interference penalty against Kansas City on a third-and-22 play.
lead_paragraph: Tennessee was handed a huge gift in the form of a pass interference penalty against Kansas City on a third-and-22 play, and that was just the boost the Titans needed to finish off a 75-yard drive, culminating with Ryan Tannehill completing a 1-yard touchdown pass to tackle Dennis Kelly, who had been declared an eligible receiver in the jumbo package. Tennessee now leads, 17-7, early in the second quarter.
